goals.question: What is the trend of the number of incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Line chart of the number of incidents reported over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the overall pattern of the incidents reported during the LA riots and identify any spikes or dips in the number of incidents.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the severity of the incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Histogram of the severity of incidents
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of the severity of incidents and identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the severity of incidents and the number of people arrested?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of severity of incidents vs number of people arrested
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between the severity of incidents and the number of people arrested, and if so, how strong the correlation is.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the race of the victims of the incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the race of the victims
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of the race of the victims and identify any disparities or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the types of incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of the types of incidents
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of the types of incidents and identify any dominant or rare types of incidents.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.groupby('date').size().reset_index(name='count')
    chart = sns.lineplot(x='date', y='count', data=data)
    chart.set(xlabel='Date', ylabel='Number of Incidents Reported')
    plt.title('What is the trend of the number of incidents reported during the LA riots?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['severity'] = pd.to_numeric(data['severity'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['severity'])
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='severity', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['severity'].median(), color='red', label=f'Median: {data["severity"].median():.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the severity of the incidents reported during the LA riots?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['severity'] = pd.to_numeric(data['severity'], errors='coerce')
    data['arrests'] = pd.to_numeric(data['arrests'], errors='coerce')
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='severity', y='arrests', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the severity of incidents and the number of people arrested?', wrap=True)
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Race'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the race of the victims of the incidents reported during the LA riots?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['incident_type'].value_counts().plot(kind='pie', autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90, shadow=False, legend=True, fontsize=14)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the types of incidents reported during the LA riots?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
